main_definition: Refers to something that is inherent, not artificial or forced; arising from nature rather than society.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Inherent and unspoiled characteristics of a person or thing
meanings_and_examples.example: Her natural talent for music was evident right from childhood.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Not caused by human intervention; arising spontaneously
meanings_and_examples.example: The sunflower turned towards the sun, following its natural course of movement.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Relating to or obtained from nature as opposed to being manufactured or produced by humans
meanings_and_examples.example: She uses only natural ingredients in her cooking for a healthier diet.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Free from artificial additives, preservatives, or other human-made substances; pure and unadulterated
meanings_and_examples.example: The company promotes its products as 100% natural with no added chemicals.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Occurring in the normal course of events without any external influence or manipulation
meanings_and_examples.example: His recovery was a matter of time, it seemed entirely natural for him to get better eventually.
